text.text: The Neo-Geo Pocket Color (or NGPC) is SNK's 16-bit portable console released in 1999 and follows the monochrome version. It allows you to set the language in the system that is then used by the games, a cable exists to play with friends in network and it has 40 hours of autonomy for only 2 AA batteries. It has a 16-bit processor at 6Mhz, 16K of RAM, a 256x256 display in 146 colors out of 4096 and a sound with 4 channels. Despite his hits such as King of Fighters R-2, Metal Slug, Sonic Pocket Adventure and SNK vs. Capcom it will be a failure for lack of communication.
